alert.note: Alert for North Beltrami (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:18PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Beltrami County through 545 PM CDT... At 518 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over eastern Lower Red Lake, or 32 miles north of Bemidji, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Saum around 525 PM CDT. Shotley around 530 PM CDT. Otto around 535 PM CDT. Waskish and BIg Bog State Recreation Area around 545 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for north central Minnesota.
